meanings.definition: To move quickly up and down or side to side
meanings.sent1: She likes to jiggle the keys to make noise.
meanings.sent2: The jello on the plate started to jiggle when she bumped the table.
meanings.sent3: The toddler would jiggle with excitement every time the music played.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the tree would jiggle in the wind, creating a mesmerizing dance.
meanings.sent5: The loose doorknob would jiggle whenever someone tried to open the door.

meanings.sent1: The jiggle of the water in the glass caught her attention.
meanings.sent2: With a quick jiggle, he adjusted the loose screw on the chair.
meanings.sent3: The jiggle of the puppy's tail showed its excitement to see its owner.
meanings.sent4: The jiggle of the coins in his pocket reminded him of his dwindling savings.
meanings.sent5: The jiggle of the jello made it look like it was alive.
